name: Salalah Marriott Resort

reviews.text: Excellent value for money. First I thought my wife would be lonely in my business trip. Hotel staff are very friendly. She would have enjoyed looking at the pool and the beach. Location is superb. Climate was very nice. All types of fresh seafood was avilable and the taste is very delicious. I would like to visit again and relax here. Also I will recommend my adult children to visit this hotel during their vacation.
reviews.title: VALUE FOR MONEY

reviews.text: Better than I imagined...So beautiful,peaceful&the best food I have ever had,always new dishes &top quality service:)
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly,warm &serviceminded staff,so I definitely understand why people we met at this hotel always kept coming back there.
reviews.title: Nothing Works!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am already planning for my next trip back to Salalah& Mariott Resort& hope to be able to arrange for our marriage there<3
reviews.title: Isolated but beautiful

reviews.text: The check in was terrible, they didn't find our reservation and we had to hear the manager jokes about this and do nothing. The location is terrible, miles from Salalah and in the middle of nothing. The pool is the largest of Oman, but it's cold, you can't stay. The room was ok but has a lot of mosquitos singing all the night in our ears. The buffet at night and the breakfast was average with poor service and finally the wifi internet in the lobby is free but doesn't work at all... We'll never stay here again, you have a lot of better choices there...
reviews.title: DON'T waste your time

reviews.text: Everything the hotel provides is just about OK, but over all it is under par for a Marriott hotel.
reviews.title: Under par for a Marriott hotel
Just perfect
reviews.text: Rooms are OK but very unpersonal, it feels very much like an American motel in mid price.
Staff is friendly, but not always very competent.
reviews.title: Great weekend away

reviews.text: The pool area is nice, especially for families with kids - but this has the same tacky music palying all day. The beach is not really usable though, there are rocks & algae in the sea, the sand is not clean.
reviews.title: Far but peaceful

reviews.text: Food is OK, but certainly not great. Two of the onsite restaurants were closed when we visited the the hotel between Christmas and New Year. All inside dining areas have truly horrible elevator music all the the time, the outside areas have not enough sunshades or in the evening sodium lighting better suitable for streets. Service is dog slow, but friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent & Relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 days at the hotel during August. First 3 days were great as the hotel was quite and empty. Once EID started it was completely full and the staff could not manage at all. Mind you even during the first few days the service was not great and quite slow. On checking out we waited over an half an hour for a porter and eventually struggled out by ourselves.
reviews.title: Good Location, Poor Service, Overall good value for money

reviews.text: The location is good for sight seeing but is a way out of Salalah itself so it is a bit isolated, although we like the peace and quite.
reviews.title: Not what I expected!

reviews.text: The rooms that we had asked for were not given to us...the excuse was that the hotel was fully booked and that it was too late to make changes. I had done my reservation with booking.com for me and my friends and the hotel had guaranteed the room for us. I did not see more than 15 people staying at that hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Short Break in a beautiful location

reviews.text: The service at the restaurant where we were having breakfast was very poor as well...I certainly would never go back to that hotel.
reviews.title: Long Weekend in Salalah Marriot Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Salalah after Eid for 3 nights. The property is about 1 hour drive from the airport. Don't let it put you off. It is worth it. Hotel does offer complimentary transfer to and from the airport. The Location is beautiful. Must get a Sea View or Pool View room. Rooms on 1st floor are best as you can walk out on the pool area. There is nothing nearby the hotel, so be prepared. Hotel is a typical Marriott., good rooms and good service. The Pool is excellent, as it is huge. The food in the restaurant is very good. Hotel offers extremely good value for money on the rates they charge. Weather was very nice. In August it was 25C .. this is amazing , considering the rest of the gulf is 40+ C.
reviews.title: 2 Star Experience in the name of 5 Star Hotel

reviews.text: The reason for the title is that the hotel has two seasons, one when rest of the region becomes hot and that is for locals to come here, We Europeans in general and Swedish in particular travel during winter and therefore might have different views as we want warmth.
reviews.title: review for Swedish guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the two week stay we were never bored with the food and definitely the most delicious food I have ever tasted in a hotel. During the season we foreigners come there are a lot of rooms available and we are well taken care. The staff are happy and when we wanted to decide who deserves tip we noticed we had to borrow money as they all were perfect.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.text: The manager eats lunch everyday with the guests and he is highly respected and liked by the staff. I think he is there with family which ensures the quality of food and you really feel like family.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Salalah

reviews.text: A lot of stones and big rocks are found at the beach. However plenty of great sand. You will not need special shoes however there are plenty of broken shells that might hurt you but no bottles.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: There is some sea weed the almost two km shore the hotel has but a small area is usually cleaned for the guests. You will see a lot of wild life, well as much as could be expected close to desert. These included one snake, millions of shellfish and crabs, turtle (dead one however), fish small and large, lizards and a pair of camels.None of these inside the hotel.
reviews.title: poor

description: The Salalah Marriott Resort is set on the idyllic shores of the Arabian Sea on the white sandy beaches of Mirbat Cove and at the foot of Jebel Samhan, an approximate 45min drive (75 kilometers) from Salalah International Airport. The Dhofar region, in the South of Oman, is the land of gardens, mountain springs, historical treasures and natural beauty. The Salalah Marriott Resort in Mirbat offers luxurious rooms and suites with sea and mountain views as well as chalets at the beach. This Resort is the ideal place for a family vacation, meetings or weddings with its dining, conference and leisure facilities. The Salalah Marriott Resort is the first Marriott Resort in Oman.
